alert.note: Alert for Oconee (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 05 at 1:44PM EDT until September 05 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL RABUN AND NORTHWESTERN OCONEE COUNTIES... At 144 PM EDT, emergency management reported ongoing flash flooding in the Lakemont area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. Widespread heavy rain showers have tapered off to isolated lighter showers. Additional rainfall amounts should mostly be light, but any ongoing flood water is expected to be slow to recede. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clayton, Tiger, Tallulah Falls, Lakemont, Long Creek, Pine Mountain, and Mountain Rest. Portions of Shady Lane and Old Highway 441 in Lakemont will remain water covered near the confluence of Tiger Creek and the Tallulah River. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
